intro: Corchorus greveanus, commonly known as the African kochia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features distinctive, palmate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Corchorus greveanus is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
